intro: Euploca humilis, commonly known as the dwarf euploca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of only a few inches. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and wetlands. Euploca humilis is known for its ability to tolerate salt spray and is an important species in its native habitat.
